page.title: 11Landscape in Bromp on Swale
page.content:
The{river Swale}one of the fastest rivers in England runs through Brompton.In the river most of the fish are brown trout.The river is a tourist attraction and good for angling. People buy houses with gardens that have a good view of the river. The Swale banks are getting cut into by the rough waters and many trees get pulled into the water by the {floods.
The land near the river is mainly flat fields and there is a lot of building.To the south of the river there is a steep{scarp}above the flood plain which is covered in deciduous woodland.
To the east extensive{sand and gravel deposits have been quarried away.
